sentence.Network_en: Once a knave, ever a knave.
sentence.Network_cn: 一次成无赖, 永远是无赖.

sentence.Network_en: Better be a fool than a knave.

list.abs: Better be a fool than knave ., 宁做傻瓜 , 不做无赖.
A crafty knave needs no broker ., 狡猾的无赖不需要有中间人.
He has shown himself a very knave ., 他暴露出是一个地道的流氓.
reports are often false , and always false when made by a knave to cloak his knavery . -- Abraham Lincoln报告常常是虚假的，而由一个恶棍为掩饰自己的恶行而作的报告，则永远是虚假的。——林肯

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cnafa 'boy, servant', of West Germanic origin; related to German Knabe 'boy'

entry.def: If someone calls a man a knave, they mean that he is dishonest and should not be trusted.
In card games, knave is another word for jack.

means.word_mean: 2. one of four face cards in a deck bearing a picture of a young prince
